Ryanair orders 75 Max 8s
Ryanair orders 75 Max 8s
AirFinance Journal
December 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 230 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
Ryanair has placed an order for 75 Boeing 737 Max aircraft.
The carrier has selected the higher-capacity 200 version of the 737-8, citing the aircraft's additional seats and 
improved fuel efficiency and environmental performance.
This brings the Dublin-based carrier's firm orderbook up to 210 for the variant. The aircraft will be delivered over a 
four year period between spring 2021 and December 2024. 
Ryanair is the launch customer for the high-capacity 737-8 variant, having placed its first order for 100 airplanes 
and 100 options in late 2014, followed by firm orders of 10 airplanes in 2017 and 25 in 2018.
Airfinance Journal's Fleet Tracker shows that the Irish carrier has yet to take delivery of the type.
The announcement follows the Federal Aviation Administration's lifting of its ban on the Max.
The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) is expected to issue a final airworthiness directive formally 
clearing the way for the Boeing 737 Max to return to European skies in January 2021.
"Ryanair will continue to play a leading role in our industry when Europe recovers from the Covid-19 pandemic and 
air traffic returns to growth across the continent. We are gratified that Ryanair is once again placing its confidence in 
the Boeing 737 family and building their future fleet with this enlarged firm order," said Dave Calhoun, president and 
chief executive of Boeing.
Load-Date: December 21, 2020
End of Document
Ryanair debt surges through pandemic
Ryanair debt surges through pandemic
AirFinance Journal
December 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 239 words
Byline: Alex Derber
Body
Ryanair's adjusted debt will have roughly tripled during its current financial year, according to analysis from S&P 
Global Ratings.
The agency expects the low-cost carrier's debt to reach up to (EURO)1.2 billion ($1.45 billion) by 31 March 2021, 
from about (EURO)434 million a year earlier.
S&P also forecasts an adjusted EBITDA loss of (EURO)150 million to (EURO)160 million for Ryanair this fiscal 
year, versus a (EURO)1.48 billion EBITDA profit in 2019/20.
However, if vaccine rollouts prove successful by the middle of next year, S&P expects Ryanair to be cash flow 
positive in 2021/22. As a result, it has affirmed the airline's BBB rating, albeit with a negative outlook.
"We assume a significant rebound in air traffic in the second half of calendar year 2021, underpinned by our current 
view that the several effective vaccines against COVID-19 will become widely available by the middle of 2021 and 
help to lessen or lift travel restrictions and restore passenger confidence in flying," stated S&P analysts.
They added: "To revise the outlook to stable, we would need to be confident that demand conditions are 
normalizing and the recovery is robust enough to enable Ryanair to partly restore its financial strength."
S&P also noted that Ryanair has taken significant measures to lower capital expenditure, including spending only 
(EURO)300 million on maintenance this fiscal year versus a pre-pandemic prediction of (EURO)2 billion.
Load-Date: December 28, 2020
End of Document
ALC trims 737 Max orders again
ALC trims 737 Max orders again
AirFinance Journal
December 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 301 words
Byline: Dominic Lalk
Body
Boeing has disclosed cancellations of another 88 Boeing 737 Max aircraft in the month to 30 November, including 
an additional 13 cancelled Max orders from Air Lease (ALC).
This brings ALC's outright cancellations of the type to 32 aircraft this year.
California-based ALC cut its 737 Max orderbook by another 14 aircraft in the third quarter "in line with our 
contractual rights to do so", lessor chief executive John Plueger said. In March, ALC converted orders for nine 737 
Max units to three 787 aircraft; in the second quarter the lessor cancelled five Max aircraft.
The U.S. lessor's 737 Max backlog now stands at 113 Max units, Boeing data shows.
ALC said it canceled orders on "a case-by-case basis" following discussions with its airline customers.
ALC also had options for another 45 737 Max 8s with Boeing, but these have expired without being exercised.
Last month, Alaska Airlines agreed to sell and lease back 10 Airbus A320s with ALC as part of a transaction that 
will also see ALC place 13 737 Max 9s at the airline. Alaska said that the Max 9s will be delivered from the fourth 
quarter of 2021 and come from the lessor's orderbook.
Other customers who cancelled 737 Max orders in November included Air Canada and Virgin Australia.
Earlier this month, and thus not reflected in the aforementioned figures, Ryanair placed an order for 75 additional 
737 Max aircraft.
Boeing had 4,240 aircraft left in its backlog to 30 November after taking more than 1,100 off its books in 2020 - 
almost 500 outright cancellations and more than 600 aircraft removed following ASC606 adjustments.
The U.S. OEM's remaining backlog includes 3,333 737 programme aircraft, nine 747s, 81 767s, 346 777s and 471 
787s.
In the 11 months to 30 November, Boeing delivered 118 aircraft and received new orders for 94 commercial units.
ALC trims 737 Max orders again
Load-Date: December 28, 2020
End of Document
HSBC downgrades Wizz on overstretched share price
HSBC downgrades Wizz on overstretched share price
AirFinance Journal
December 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 639 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
HSBC has downgraded Wizz Air from buy to hold after concluding that its current market valuation is "more 
stretched" than a number of its European peers.
Having analysed the share price of Wizz, Easyjet, IAG and Ryanair using an equity value (EV) analysis, a reverse 
discounted cash flow (DCF) calculation and price to net asset value, the bank concluded that Wizz's valuation 
appears "most demanding".
It stated that the airline's stock is trading within 5% of its target price, making a downgrade necessary.  HSBC's 
analysts noted that airline share prices have responded very positively to recent favourable news about vaccines.
Share prices for stocks in its European coverage are up 58% in the past month.
Wizz Air is trading at an "extremely high premium" to net asset value, which reflects the business's asset light 
structure, operating almost entirely leased aircraft and operating mainly from secondary airports without slot value.
The medium-term EBIT margin implied by its current share price is higher than its five-year average EBIT, which is 
unique to the group, HSBC stated.
Its EV now is 26% ahead of it pre-pandemic level, up the most of all carriers. These metrics imply sustained future 
value creation and that the company has stronger prospects than before the pandemic.
"We think these are both fair assumptions, although the scale of future outperformance relative to history becomes 
a matter for debate in our view," the bank said.
Ryanair's valuation appears to be the "second most demanding" the HSBC note stated, though it appears 
attractively valued on a reverse DCF basis.
It trades at a 137% premium to its NAV. The medium-term EBIT margin implied by its current share price is 5.2pts 
lower than its five-year average EBIT. Its EV now is 14% ahead of its pre-pandemic level, up the second most of all 
carriers.
"These metrics imply sustained future value creation and that the company has stronger prospects than before the 
pandemic. We think these are both fair assumptions," the note stated.
HSBC downgrades Wizz on overstretched share price
IAG's valuation appears the second-least demanding across each of the metrics. It trades at a 26% premium to its 
NAV.
The medium-term EBIT margin implied by its current share price is 3.7 points lower than its five-year average EBIT.
Its EV now is 4% lower than its pre-pandemic level. These metrics imply sustained future value creation and that 
the company has stronger prospects than before the pandemic, the bank stated.
Easyjet's valuation appears the least demanding across each of the metrics. It trades at a 5% premium to its NAV. 
The medium-term EBIT margin implied by its current share price is 3.7 points lower than its five-year average EBIT. 
Its EV now is 14% lower than pre-pandemic level.
Separately, Liberum analyst Gerald Khoo noted that Easyjet's stock price may offer better value than Ryanair's, 
with the latter's fundamental strengths remaining "attractive, but are priced in at its current share price".    Khoo said 
that Ryanair remains the market leader in European short-haul aviation, with low unit costs, cost flexibility and a 
strong balance sheet.    "However, we believe these strengths are adequately reflected in the share price, even with 
the greater optimism created by the prospect of a Covid vaccine and the group's bullish fleet plan and passenger 
growth targets," he said.   A key part of Liberum's recent shift to a positive stance on Easyjet was confidence the 
group is dealing with pre-pandemic concerns about non-fuel unit costs and poor free cash flow. Overheads are 
being cut, seasonal bases and staff contracts are being introduced, and capital expenditure is being scaled back.
Easyjet's 2021 Capex is now at £600 million ($801 million) versus £950 million planned a year ago; for 2020 it is 
planned at £600 million to £800 million, versus £1.2 billion expected this time last year.
Load-Date: December 28, 2020
End of Document
Ryanair 's (RYAAY) Overweight Rating Reiterated at JPMorgan Chase & Co.

https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgJPMorgan Chase &#38; Co.[1] reaffirmed their 
overweight rating on shares of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in a report released on Friday morning, The Fly[2] 
reports.RYAAY has been the subject of a number of other research reports. Liberum Capital downgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Monday, September 14th. 
Credit Suisse Group reaffirmed an outperform rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, 
November 10th. UBS Group downgraded shares of Ryanair from a buy rating to a neutral rating in a research report 
on Thursday, November 12th. BidaskClub downgraded shares of Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a 
research report on Tuesday, September 29th. Finally, ValuEngine[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a hold rating to 
a buy rating in a research report on Thursday, October 1st. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock 
with a sell rating, six have issued a hold rating and twelve have assigned a buy rating to the company's stock. The 
stock has an average rating of Buy and a consensus price target of $84.00.Shares of RYAAY stock[4] opened at 
$103.77 on Friday. The firm has a 50-day moving average price of $93.45 and a 200 day moving average price of 
$79.72. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $44.44 and a twelve month high of $109.65. The company has a market 
capitalization of $23.36 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 91.83 and a beta of 1.40. The company has a current 
ratio of 0.67, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its 
earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation company reported ($0.12) earnings per share for 
the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. Ryanair had a net margin of 3.61% and a return on 
equity of 10.45%. The firm had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of 
$1.17 billion. As a group, research analysts predict that Ryanair will post -5.16 earnings per share for the current 
year. Institutional investors and hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of the company. FMR LLC 
increased its holdings in Ryanair by 30.9% in the second quarter. FMR LLC now owns 5,276,515 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $350,045,000 after purchasing an additional 1,246,442 shares during the 
last quarter. JPMorgan Chase &#38; Co. increased its stake in shares of Ryanair by 317.6% during the third 
quarter. JPMorgan Chase &#38; Co. now owns 851,985 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$68,602,000 after purchasing an additional 647,965 shares during the period. BlackRock Inc. increased its stake in 
shares of Ryanair by 605.0% during the third quarter. BlackRock Inc. now owns 419,697 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $34,314,000 after purchasing an additional 360,167 shares during the period. 
Sprucegrove Investment Management Ltd. increased its stake in shares of Ryanair by 22.7% during the second 
quarter. Sprucegrove Investment Management Ltd. now owns 1,880,474 shares of the transportation company's

Financial Services Co. MA increased its stake in shares of Ryanair by 3.7% during the third quarter. Massachusetts

Mike Clements kicks off new fund with ‘stock you love to hate’
Mike Clements kicks off new fund with ‘stock you love to hate’
Citywire
December 1, 2020 Tuesday 8:30 AM GMT
Copyright 2020 Citywire Financial Publishers All Rights Reserved
Length: 517 words
Byline: Chris Sloley
Highlight: Former Syz manager’s new venture set to take advantage of value rally with allocation to surprising 
income names.
Body
Mike Clements is keen to keep his contrarian ethos alive with the launch of his new unconstrained European equity 
income fund, by kicking it off with a focus on several ‘unloved’ names.
Clements joined UK group Downing Fund Managers in November after stepping down from Syz Group, where he 
had been head of European equities up until his departure in June.
In his new venture, which he will co-run with Pras Jeyanandhan, Clements will focus the VT Downing European 
Unconstrained Income fund on undervalued companies, most notably budget airline Ryanair.
‘While we don’t class ourselves value investors per se, the recent run on value and recovery stocks which followed 
the announcement of Pfizer’s and Moderna’s successful vaccine trials, could set an entirely new backdrop for 
investing both in Europe and more globally.
‘Without getting too much into our investment process, we look for two types of companies in our portfolio; 
contrarian opportunities and under the radar companies. We essentially look for what we consider to be 
undervalued companies which you won’t typically find in the large-cap dividend paying sectors.’
Clements, who branded Ryanair ‘a stock everyone loves to hate’, said it remains the best airline in Europe. He said 
the stock price has obviously been hit by lockdown and limitations on flights but this will not last forever and the 
stock will inevitably rebound.
‘The investment case for Ryanair is a well-known one, however there are often times when investors get scared 
over a company’s short-term prospects. As long-term investors, taking a five-year view, we still believe Ryanair is 
going to take market share away from competitors such as British Airways, Lufthansa and Air France. We think it is 
a long-term winner and right now we can buy it cheaply simply because there is fear in the market.’
Focusing on confidence and patience, Clements said Ryanair is a classic undervalued stock, which has undergone 
huge share price movements, rocking from €12-per-share to €16 in the week of various vaccine announcements.
Mike Clements kicks off new fund with ‘stock you love to hate’
‘When I think about what contrarian investing looks like in practice, there are two legs of performance to consider. 
The first is what has happened in the last few weeks, which we can call a knee-jerk, sentiment-driven relief rally. 
This is exactly what has happened to many travel and leisure stocks since a potential solution to Covid-19 was 
announced.’
Clements said he had focused on Ryanair as opposed to larger carriers, namely British Airways, as government 
bailouts and other support systems meant the competitive dynamics had changed considerably.
‘The acid test of a high-quality business is one that can come through a crisis not only unscathed, but in a stronger 
position than it went into it. We believe Ryanair is a classic example of this, and love or hate it, it is around to stay.’
Linked to the return of air travel, Clements also name-checked Spanish travel technology company Amadeus, 
which is the booking engine behind airline ticket sales. He said the stock shares many characteristics with Ryanair 
and had been closely watched since March.
Load-Date: December 3, 2020
End of Document
Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Rating Reiterated by The Goldman Sachs Group
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Rating Reiterated by The Goldman Sachs Group
Newstex Blogs

December 1, 2020 Tuesday 8:05 AM EST

https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgThe Goldman Sachs Group reiterated their buy 
rating on shares of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in a research note released on Monday, The Fly[1] reports.Several 
other research firms have also recently weighed in on RYAAY. Morgan Stanley restated an overweight rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 3rd. 
Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Monday, September 14th. 
BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Tuesday, September 29th. UBS 
Group downgraded shares of Ryanair from a buy rating to a neutral rating in a report on Thursday, November 12th. 
Finally, Credit Suisse Group reiterated an outperform rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 
10th. Two analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued a hold rating and twelve have issued a 
buy rating to the stock. Ryanair currently has an average rating of Buy and a consensus price target of 
$84.00.Shares of RYAAY stock[2] opened at $103.77 on Monday. The company has a current ratio of 0.67, a quick 
ratio of 0.67 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57. The stock has a market cap of $23.36 billion, a P/E ratio of 91.83 and 
a beta of 1.40. The stock has a 50 day simple moving average of $93.45 and a 200 day simple moving average of 
$79.72. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $44.44 and a 1 year high of $109.65. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released 
its earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation company reported ($0.12) earnings per share for 
the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a 
net margin of 3.61%. The firm had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of 
$1.17 billion. Analysts forecast that Ryanair will post -5.16 EPS for the current year. Hedge funds and other 
institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the stock. Private Advisor Group LLC acquired a new 
stake in Ryanair in the second quarter valued at $25,000. Hexagon Capital Partners LLC acquired a new stake in 
Ryanair in the third quarter valued at $30,000. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its holdings in Ryanair by 
239.7% during the 2nd quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 822 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $55,000 after acquiring an additional 580 shares during the period. PNC Financial Services 
Group Inc. raised its position in shares of Ryanair by 23.5% in the 2nd quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. 
now owns 958 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $64,000 after acquiring an additional 182 shares 
in the last quarter. Finally, Pacer Advisors Inc. bought a new position in shares of Ryanair in the 3rd quarter worth 
about $77,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 44.15% of the company's stock. About RyanairRyanair 
Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United 
Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various

ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of 'Hold' from Brokerages
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation 
of 'Hold' from Brokerages
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
November 30, 2020 Monday 8:30 AM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1054 words
Body
Nov 30, 2020( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of 'Hold' from Brokerages November 30th, 2020 - 
Comments Off on Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of 'Hold' from 
Brokerages - Filed Under[1] - by Nicole Kennedy[2]    Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have 
earned a consensus rating of 'Hold' from the twenty analysts that are currently covering the company, 
MarketBeat[3] reports. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell recommendation, six have assigned a 
hold recommendation and eleven have assigned a buy recommendation to the company. The average 1-year price 
target among brokerages that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $84.00.  A number of 
research firms recently weighed in on RYAAY. Peel Hunt began coverage on Ryanair in a research note on 
Tuesday, September 22nd. 
They set a 'sell' rating on the stock. JPMorgan Chase &#38; Co. reaffirmed an 'overweight' rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research note on Friday. Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research 
note on Monday, September 14th. Credit Suisse Group reaffirmed an 'outperform' rating on shares of Ryanair in a 
research note on Tuesday, November 10th. Finally, Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft reaffirmed a 'buy' rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a research note on Thursday, October 1st. Hedge funds have recently added to or reduced 
their stakes in the company. Capital International Sarl grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 7.3% during the 3rd 
quarter. Capital International Sarl now owns 70,656 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$5,777,000 after acquiring an additional 4,823 shares during the period. Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU 
Quebec grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 7.7% during the 3rd quarter. Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU 
Quebec now owns 1,300,094 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $106,296,000 after acquiring 
an additional 92,900 shares during the period. UBS Asset Management Americas Inc. grew its position in shares of 
Ryanair by 1.2% during the 3rd quarter. UBS Asset Management Americas Inc. now owns 233,096 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $19,058,000 after acquiring an additional 2,700 shares during the period. 
Guggenheim Capital LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 24.3% during the 3rd quarter. Guggenheim 
Capital LLC now owns 8,286 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $677,000 after acquiring an 
additional 1,620 shares during the period. Finally, Great West Life Assurance Co. Can grew its position in shares of 
Ryanair by 17.8% during the 3rd quarter. Great West Life Assurance Co. Can now owns 1,103,165 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $79,337,000 after acquiring an additional 166,600 shares during the 
period. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 44.15% of the company's stock.   Shares of 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of 'Hold' from Brokerages
NASDAQ:RYAAY[4] opened at $103.87 on Monday. The company has a market capitalization of $23.38 billion, a 
price-to-earnings ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a current ratio of 
0.67 and a quick ratio of 0.67. The business's 50-day moving average is $92.46 and its 200-day moving average is 
$78.97. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $44.44 and a 1 year high of $109.65. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last 
announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation company reported ($0.12) 
earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating analysts' consensus estimates of ($0.26) by $0.14. The company 
had revenue of $1.23 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.17 billion. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%. Analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post -5.16 EPS for the 
current year.  About Ryanair Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger 
airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also 
involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related 
services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car 
hire, and travel insurance through its Website and mobile app. Featured Story: Do equity income investments

Amelia signs one-way code-share partnership with Air France
Amelia signs one-way code-share partnership with Air France
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
November 30, 2020
Copyright 2020 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News and Features; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 332 words
Body
Amelia International (NL, Ljubljana) has signed a one-way code-share partnership with Air France (AF, Paris CDG) 
covering both of its independent scheduled routes, from Paris Orly to Clermont-Ferrand and Rodez. The Slovenian 
regional specialist, which is owned by France's Regourd Aviation (Paris Le Bourget), has an established wet-lease 
partnership with the flag carrier. According to the ch-aviation fleets advanced module, it operates services from Orly 
to Aurillac, Brive-la-Gaillarde Vallée de la Dordogne, Castres, and Lourdes/Tarbes on behalf of Air France using a 
mix of ATR42-500 and E145 aircraft. 
However, its two in-house services have thus far not been integrated into Air France's network. All of Air France's 
frequent flyer benefits will also be extended to Amelia flights, as part of the partnership. Amelia International 
operates both in-house routes 11x weekly in its regular schedule, the ch-aviation schedules module shows. 
However, due to ongoing movement restrictions in France, it currently flies only 3x weekly to Rodez (using the 
Embraer regional jets). Flights to Clermont-Ferrand were suspended at the end of October 2020, Flightradar24 
ADS-B data shows. Amelia is the sole carrier serving Rodez on a scheduled basis. Clermont-Ferrand sees Air 
France services to Paris CDG, operated by HOP!, as well as scheduled Ryanair services to Porto. Separately, 
Amelia International announced that it would operate five scheduled flights from Clermont-Ferrand to each of Nice 
and Paris-Orly between December 19, 2020, and January 3, 2021. These services will cater to an expected uptick 
in domestic demand around the holiday period.
AirGuide and Pyramid Media connects you to an affluent, influential group of business and leisure travelers from 
across 
the 
globe 
with

and

Destinations 
Magazine.

and For Tech and Content Solutions.

End of Document

The Goldman Sachs Group Reiterates Buy Rating for Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
The Goldman Sachs Group Reiterates Buy Rating for Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
November 30, 2020 Monday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 633 words
Body
Ryanair logo Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY)'s stock had its "buy" rating reiterated by analysts at The Goldman Sachs 
Group in a research note issued on Monday, The Fly  reports. 
A number of other brokerages also recently issued reports on RYAAY. Raymond James upped their price target on 
Ryanair from $90.00 to $100.00 and gave the stock an "outperform" rating in a research report on Wednesday, 
October 7th. UBS Group downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "neutral" rating in a research report on 
Thursday, November 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co.  reissued an "overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a 
research report on Friday. Credit Suisse Group  reissued an "outperform" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research 
report on Tuesday, November 10th. Finally, ValuEngine  raised Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a 
research report on Thursday, October 1st. Two investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have 
given a hold rating and twelve have given a buy rating to the company. Ryanair  has an average rating of "Buy" and 
a consensus target price of $84.00. 
NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded down $0.10 during trading hours on Monday, reaching $103.77. The company's stock 
had a trading volume of 538,402 shares, compared to its average volume of 688,012. The company has a market 
capitalization of $23.36 billion, a P/E ratio of 91.83 and a beta of 1.40. Ryanair has a 12 month low of $44.44 and a 
12 month high of $109.65. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a current ratio 
of 0.67. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $92.46 and a two-hundred day moving average price of 
$78.97.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of 
($0.26) by $0.14. The business had revenue of $1.23 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of 
$1.17 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  As a group, analysts predict 
that  Ryanair will post -5.16 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
Large investors have recently bought and sold shares of the business. Hexagon Capital Partners LLC purchased a 
new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth about $30,000.  Private Advisor Group LLC purchased 
a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about $25,000.  Rockefeller Capital Management 
L.P. boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 239.7% during the 2nd quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management 
L.P. now owns 822 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $55,000 after acquiring an additional 580 
shares in the last quarter.  Pacer Advisors Inc. purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 3rd quarter 
The Goldman Sachs Group Reiterates Buy Rating for Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
worth about $77,000.  Finally, PNC Financial Services Group Inc. boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 23.5% 
during the 2nd quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 958 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $64,000 after acquiring an additional 182 shares in the last quarter. 44.15% of the stock is currently 
owned by institutional investors.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

SG Americas Securities LLC Reduces Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
SG Americas Securities LLC Reduces Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
November 30, 2020 Monday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 709 words
Body
Ryanair logo SG Americas Securities LLC trimmed its stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 43.1% 
during the third quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission 
(SEC). The fund owned 7,757 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 5,878 shares during the 
period. SG Americas Securities LLC's holdings in Ryanair were worth $634,000 at the end of the most recent 
quarter.  
Other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of the company. CWM 
Advisors LLC grew its position in  Ryanair by 1.7% during the 2nd quarter. CWM Advisors LLC now owns 10,996 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $730,000 after purchasing an additional 179 shares during the 
last quarter.  PNC Financial Services Group Inc. grew its position in  Ryanair by 23.5% during the 2nd quarter. PNC 
Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 958 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $64,000 after 
purchasing an additional 182 shares during the last quarter.  Janney Montgomery Scott LLC boosted its holdings in 
shares of  Ryanair by 4.4% in the third quarter. Janney Montgomery Scott LLC now owns 4,789 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $392,000 after acquiring an additional 203 shares in the last quarter.  
Private Advisor Group LLC purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the second quarter valued at about 
$25,000.  Finally, Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 239.7% in the 
second quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 822 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $55,000 after acquiring an additional 580 shares in the last quarter. 44.15% of the stock is currently 
owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
RYAAY  opened at $103.87 on Monday. The company has a quick ratio of 0.67, a current ratio of 0.67 and a debt-
to-equity ratio of 0.57. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $44.44 and a 52-week high of $109.65. The 
company has a 50 day moving average of $92.46 and a two-hundred day moving average of $78.97. The company 
has a market cap of $23.38 billion, a P/E ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by 
$0.14. Ryanair had a net margin of 3.61% and a return on equity of 10.45%. The company had revenue of $1.23 
billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.17 billion.  Research analysts anticipate that  
Ryanair Holdings plc will post -5.16 earnings per share for the current year.  
SG Americas Securities LLC Reduces Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
RYAAY has been the topic of several analyst reports. Credit Suisse Group  reaffirmed an "outperform" rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 10th. JPMorgan Chase & Co.  reiterated an "overweight" 
rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Friday. BidaskClub cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a 
"hold" rating in a research report on Tuesday, September 29th. UBS Group cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" 
rating to a "neutral" rating in a research report on Thursday, November 12th. Finally, Deutsche Bank 
Aktiengesellschaft  restated a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Thursday, October 1st. Two 
investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued  a hold rating and eleven have given a 
buy rating to the stock. The company presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of 
$84.00. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

Ryanair logo Great West Life Assurance Co. Can lifted its position in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 17.8% in the third quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The firm 
owned 1,103,165 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 166,600 shares 
during the quarter. Great West Life Assurance Co. Can owned about 0.49% of Ryanair worth $79,337,000 as of its 
most recent filing with the SEC.

research report on Tuesday, September 8th. Finally, Peel Hunt started coverage on Ryanair in a research report on

Body
Ryanair logo Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have earned a consensus rating of "Hold" from the 
twenty analysts that are currently  covering the company, MarketBeat  reports. Two research analysts have rated 
the stock with a sell recommendation, six have assigned  a hold recommendation and eleven have assigned  a buy 
recommendation to  the company. The average 1-year price target among brokerages that have updated their 
coverage on the stock in the last year is $84.00.  
A number of research firms recently weighed in on RYAAY. Peel Hunt began coverage on Ryanair in a research 
note on Tuesday, September 22nd. They set a "sell" rating on the stock. JPMorgan Chase & Co.  reaffirmed an 
"overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Friday. Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a "buy" 
rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Monday, September 14th. Credit Suisse Group  reaffirmed an 
"outperform" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 10th. Finally, Deutsche Bank 
Aktiengesellschaft  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Thursday, October 1st. 
Hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Capital International Sarl grew its 
position in shares of  Ryanair by 7.3% during the 3rd quarter. Capital International Sarl now owns 70,656 shares of 
the transportation company's stock valued at $5,777,000 after acquiring an additional 4,823 shares during the 
period.  Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 7.7% during the 3rd 
quarter. Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec now owns 1,300,094 shares of the transportation company's 
stock valued at $106,296,000 after acquiring an additional 92,900 shares during the period.  UBS Asset 
Management Americas Inc. grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 1.2% during the 3rd quarter. UBS Asset 
Management Americas Inc. now owns 233,096 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $19,058,000 
after acquiring an additional 2,700 shares during the period.  Guggenheim Capital LLC grew its position in shares of  
Ryanair by 24.3% during the 3rd quarter. Guggenheim Capital LLC now owns 8,286 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $677,000 after acquiring an additional 1,620 shares during the period.  Finally, Great 
West Life Assurance Co. Can grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 17.8% during the 3rd quarter. Great West 
Life Assurance Co. Can now owns 1,103,165 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $79,337,000 
after acquiring an additional 166,600 shares during the period. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own  
44.15% of the company's stock.  
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $103.87 on Monday. The company has a market capitalization of $23.38 
billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
current ratio of 0.67 and a quick ratio of 0.67. The business's 50-day moving average is $92.46 and its 200-day 
moving average is $78.97. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $44.44 and a 1 year high of $109.65.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The 
transportation company reported ($0.12) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating analysts' consensus 
estimates of ($0.26) by $0.14. The company had revenue of $1.23 billion for the quarter, compared to the 
consensus estimate of $1.17 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  Analysts 
anticipate that  Ryanair will post -5.16 EPS for the current year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

Nov 30, 2020( Ticker Report: http://www.tickerreport.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) have been assigned a consensus rating of "Hold" from the twenty analysts that are presently 
covering the company, MarketBeat Ratings[1] reports. Two investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
recommendation, six have issued a hold recommendation and eleven have assigned a buy recommendation to the 
company. The average 1-year price target among brokerages that have updated their coverage on the stock in the 
last year is $84.00. RYAAY has been the topic of several research analyst reports. 
JPMorgan Chase &#38; Co. reiterated an "overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Friday. 
Liberum Capital lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Monday, 
September 14th. Credit Suisse Group reissued an "outperform" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on 
Tuesday, November 10th. UBS Group downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "neutral" rating in a 
research note on Thursday, November 12th. Finally, AlphaValue raised shares of Ryanair to a "sell" rating in a 
research note on Tuesday, September 8th.Hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of the business.

acquiring an additional 803 shares during the period. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. lifted its stake in Ryanair 
by 178.6% in the second quarter. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. now owns 52,627 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $3,491,000 after buying an additional 33,738 shares during the last 
quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA lifted its stake in Ryanair by 3.7% in the third quarter.

valued at $721,295,000 after buying an additional 316,925 shares during the last quarter. Adelphi Capital LLP lifted 
its stake in Ryanair by 9.8% in the third quarter. Adelphi Capital LLP now owns 1,198,344 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $97,977,000 after buying an additional 107,444 shares during the last 
quarter. Finally, Virtu Financial LLC bought a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the second quarter valued at 
about $582,000. 44.15% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors. Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY[2]

moving average is $78.97. Ryanair has a 52-week low of $44.44 and a 52-week high of $109.65. The firm has a 
market cap of $23.38 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40. The company has a quick ratio of 
0.67, a current ratio of 0.67 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its 
earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation company reported ($0.12) earnings per share

Nov 30, 2020( Zolmax.com: http://www.zolmax.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Great West Life Assurance Co. Can 
lifted its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 17.8% during the 3rd quarter, according to 
the company in its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The institutional investor 
owned 1,103,165 shares of the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 166,600 shares during 
the period. 
Great West Life Assurance Co. Can owned about 0.49% of Ryanair worth $79,337,000 at the end of the most 
recent reporting period. Other hedge funds have also recently bought and sold shares of the company. CWM 
Advisors LLC increased its position in Ryanair by 1.7% in the second quarter. CWM Advisors LLC now owns 
10,996 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $730,000 after buying an additional 179 shares during 
the period. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. increased its position in Ryanair by 23.5% in the second quarter. 
PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 958 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $64,000 after 
buying an additional 182 shares during the period. Janney Montgomery Scott LLC increased its position in Ryanair 
by 4.4% in the third quarter. Janney Montgomery Scott LLC now owns 4,789 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $392,000 after buying an additional 203 shares during the period. Hexagon Capital Partners 
LLC acquired a new stake in Ryanair in the third quarter worth $30,000. Finally, Private Advisor Group LLC 
acquired a new stake in Ryanair in the second quarter worth $25,000. 44.15% of the stock is currently owned by 
institutional investors and hedge funds. RYAAY has been the topic of several analyst reports. Raymond James 
increased their target price on Ryanair from $90.00 to $100.00 and gave the stock an "outperform" rating in a 
research report on Wednesday, October 7th. Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
research note on Monday, September 14th. Peel Hunt assumed coverage on Ryanair in a research note on 
Tuesday, September 22nd. They issued a "sell" rating for the company. BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating 
to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, September 29th. Finally, Barclays reissued an "overweight" rating 
on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Monday, October 19th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with 
a sell rating, six have issued a hold rating and eleven have issued a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair currently has 
an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $84.00.Shares of RYAAY stock[1] opened at $103.87 
on Monday. The stock has a 50-day simple moving average of $92.46 and a 200 day simple moving average of 
$78.97. Ryanair Holdings plc has a fifty-two week low of $44.44 and a fifty-two week high of $109.65. The stock has 
a market capitalization of $23.38 billion, a P/E ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40. The company has a quick ratio of 
0.67, a current ratio of 0.67 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Shares Acquired by Great West Life Assurance Co. Can
earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation company reported ($0.12) EPS for the quarter, 
beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 
3.61%. The business had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.17 
billion. On average, sell-side analysts anticipate that Ryanair Holdings plc will post -5.16 earnings per share for the 
current year. Ryanair ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger 
airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also 
involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related

Nov 29, 2020( Zolmax.com: http://www.zolmax.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY)'s stock 
had its "overweight" rating reissued by analysts at JPMorgan Chase &#38; Co.[1] in a note issued to investors on 
Friday, The Fly[2] reports.Several other research firms have also recently commented on RYAAY. BidaskClub cut 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, September 29th. ValuEngine[3] raised Ryanair 
from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Thursday, October 1st. 
UBS Group downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "neutral" rating in a report on Thursday, November 12th. 
Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Thursday, October 
1st. Finally, Credit Suisse Group reaffirmed an "outperform" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, 
November 10th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued a hold rating and 
eleven have issued a buy rating to the company's stock. Ryanair currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an 
average price target of $84.00.NASDAQ:RYAAY[4] opened at $103.87 on Friday. Ryanair has a one year low of 
$44.44 and a one year high of $109.65. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a 
current ratio of 0.67. The stock has a market cap of $23.38 billion, a PE ratio of 91.92 and a beta of 1.40. The stock 
has a 50 day moving average price of $92.46 and a 200 day moving average price of $78.97. Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) EPS for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%. The firm had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, 
compared to analysts' expectations of $1.17 billion. As a group, analysts predict that Ryanair will post -5.16 
earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the 
company. Morgan Stanley raised its holdings in Ryanair by 52.4% in the 1st quarter. Morgan Stanley now owns 
498,607 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $26,470,000 after acquiring an additional 171,347 
shares during the period. State Street Corp lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 21.9% in the first quarter. State 
Street Corp now owns 88,058 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $4,675,000 after acquiring an 
additional 15,821 shares in the last quarter. SG Americas Securities LLC increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair 
by 70.2% in the second quarter. SG Americas Securities LLC now owns 13,635 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $905,000 after purchasing an additional 5,622 shares during the last quarter. Sumitomo 
Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 178.6% in the second quarter. Sumitomo 
Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. now owns 52,627 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $3,491,000 
after purchasing an additional 33,738 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Altium Wealth Management LLC 
Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Stock Rating Reaffirmed by JPMorgan Chase & Co.
increased its stake in Ryanair by 53.1% during the second quarter. Altium Wealth Management LLC now owns 
6,638 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $440,000 after acquiring an additional 2,301 shares 
during the last quarter. 44.15% of the stock is owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. About

Japanese Airline ANA Plans to Raise $3.18 Billion to Pay for Planned Boeing 787 Aircraft Purchases, Prop up 
Finances
Japanese Airline ANA Plans to Raise $3.18 Billion to Pay for Planned Boeing 
787 Aircraft Purchases, Prop up Finances
MT Newswires Live Briefs PRO
November 27, 2020 Friday 6:44 AM EST
Copyright 2020 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 289 words
Body
 Japanese airline ANA (9202.T) unveiled plans on Friday to sell up to 332.1 billion yen ($3.18 billion) of shares to 
pay for Boeing (BA) aircraft while bolstering its finances amid the continuing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.
The carrier plans to sell 140 million shares by way of an offering of new shares as well as third-party allotment, 
according to a statement.
Shares will be sold in a public offering in Japan as well as through an international offering of 35 million shares 
targeting global investors.
The company said of the total money raised, 200 billion yen was set to be deployed through March 31, 2023, for 
capital expenditure to generate "medium to long-term growth." It includes the purchase of two models of Boeing 787 
aircraft to "optimize" demand with supply in the years ahead as well as reduce the carrier's environmental footprint. 
Airlines such as Ryanair (RYAAY) in Ireland, the biggest budget carrier in Europe, have said they expect pre-
coronavirus level of demand to return by 2023.
The remainder of the capital raised will be used to repay long-term debt through March 31, 2023, and strengthen 
the airline's ability to tolerate risk.
The planned offering includes a 180-day lock up period on ANA for issuing more shares.
In a statement in October, Chief Executive Shinya Katanozaka said the company expects to report 505 billion yen in 
operating losses in the full year ending March 2021 and warned the dividend would remain suspended in the 
current fiscal year. He also unveiled a 400 billion-yen subordinated loan to "maintain the soundness of our financial 
structure" as the coronavirus outbreak has hit the travel and tourism industry particularly hard.
Price: 2,540.00, Change: -45.00, Percent Change: -1.74
Japanese Airline ANA Plans to Raise $3.18 Billion to Pay for Planned Boeing 787 Aircraft Purchases, Prop up 
Finances
Load-Date: November 27, 2020
End of Document
Employees Retirement System of Texas Grows Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Employees Retirement System of Texas Grows Stock Holdings in Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
November 27, 2020 Friday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 693 words
Body
Ryanair logo Employees Retirement System of Texas grew its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
by 107.0% during the third quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission (SEC). The institutional investor  owned 115,793 shares of the transportation company's stock after 
purchasing an additional 59,860 shares during the quarter. Employees Retirement System of Texas owned about 
0.05% of Ryanair worth $9,467,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also added to or reduced their stakes in the 
business. Private Advisor Group LLC bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the second quarter valued at 
$25,000.  Hexagon Capital Partners LLC bought a new position in  Ryanair in the third quarter valued at about 
$30,000.  Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its position in  Ryanair by 239.7% in the second quarter. 
Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 822 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$55,000 after acquiring an additional 580 shares during the last quarter.  PNC Financial Services Group Inc. grew 
its position in  Ryanair by 23.5% in the second quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 958 shares of 
the transportation company's stock valued at $64,000 after acquiring an additional 182 shares during the last 
quarter.  Finally, Pacer Advisors Inc. bought a new position in  Ryanair in the third quarter valued at about $77,000. 
44.15% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  
Ryanair stock  opened at $105.38 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a quick ratio of 0.67 
and a current ratio of 0.67. The business's 50-day simple moving average is $92.10 and its 200-day simple moving 
average is $78.73. The firm has a market capitalization of $23.72 billion, a PE ratio of 93.26 and a beta of 1.40. 
Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $44.44 and a 52 week high of $109.65.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) EPS for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of ($0.26) by $0.14. The 
business had revenue of $1.23 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.17 billion. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  Research analysts forecast that  Ryanair Holdings plc will 
post -5.16 earnings per share for the current year.  
RYAAY has been the topic of a number of research reports. Morgan Stanley  reissued an "overweight" rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 3rd. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft  reaffirmed a "buy" 
rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Thursday, October 1st. Credit Suisse Group  reissued an "outperform" 
rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 10th. Barclays  reaffirmed an "overweight" rating on 
Employees Retirement System of Texas Grows Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
shares of Ryanair in a research note on Monday, October 19th. Finally, AlphaValue raised shares of Ryanair to a 
"sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, September 8th. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
rating, six have assigned  a hold rating and eleven have issued  a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock 
currently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $84.00. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives "Overweight" Rating from JPMorgan Chase & Co.
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Receives "Overweight" Rating from JPMorgan 
Chase & Co.
American Banking and Market News
November 27, 2020 Friday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 711 words
Body
Ryanair logo Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY)'s stock had its "overweight" rating restated by investment analysts at 
JPMorgan Chase & Co.  in a research note issued on Friday, The Fly  reports. 
Several other equities analysts also recently weighed in on the company. Morgan Stanley  reaffirmed an 
"overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, November 3rd. Liberum Capital 
downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Monday, September 14th. Peel 
Hunt started coverage on Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, September 22nd. They set a "sell" rating for the 
company. AlphaValue raised Ryanair to a "sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, September 8th. Finally, 
BidaskClub downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Tuesday, September 
29th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have assigned  a hold rating and eleven 
have given a buy rating to the stock. The company  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price 
of $84.00. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded down $0.04 during midday trading on Friday, reaching $105.34. 2,263 shares 
of the company's stock were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 690,722. The firm's 50 day simple 
moving average is $92.10 and its two-hundred day simple moving average is $78.73. The company has a debt-to-
equity ratio of 0.57, a current ratio of 0.67 and a quick ratio of 0.67. The stock has a market cap of $23.72 billion, a 
price-to-earnings ratio of 93.26 and a beta of 1.40. Ryanair has a fifty-two week low of $44.44 and a fifty-two week 
high of $109.65.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. 
The company had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.17 billion. 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  Equities research analysts predict that  
Ryanair will post -5.16 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
Hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the business. FMR LLC raised 
its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 30.9% during the second quarter. FMR LLC now owns 5,276,515 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $350,045,000 after purchasing an additional 1,246,442 shares during the last 
quarter.  JPMorgan Chase & Co. grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 317.6% during the third quarter. JPMorgan Chase 
& Co. now owns 851,985 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $68,602,000 after acquiring an 
additional 647,965 shares during the period.  BlackRock Inc. grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 605.0% during the 
Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives "Overweight" Rating from JPMorgan Chase & Co.
third quarter. BlackRock Inc. now owns 419,697 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $34,314,000 
after acquiring an additional 360,167 shares during the period.  Sprucegrove Investment Management Ltd. grew its 
holdings in  Ryanair by 22.7% during the second quarter. Sprucegrove Investment Management Ltd. now owns 
1,880,474 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $124,751,000 after acquiring an additional 348,100 
shares during the period.  Finally, Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 3.7% 
in the third quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,822,089 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $721,295,000 after purchasing an additional 316,925 shares during the last quarter. 
Institutional investors own  44.15% of the company's stock.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

as $15.52. Ryanair Holdings plc (RYA.L) shares last traded at $15.40, with a volume of 11,737,162 shares 
changing hands.

August 24th.

GBX 13.43 and its two-hundred day moving average is GBX 11.78. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 
112.18, a current ratio of 0.87 and a quick ratio of 0.80.  
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYA.L) Company Profile (LON:RYA ) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

(NASDAQ:RYAAY)

November 27, 2020 Friday

Ryanair logo UBS Oconnor LLC raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 2.6% 
in the 3rd quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The 
institutional investor  owned 154,710 shares of the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 
3,935 shares during the quarter. Ryanair makes up   0.4% of UBS Oconnor LLC's investment portfolio, making the 
stock its 29th largest position. UBS Oconnor LLC owned approximately 0.07% of Ryanair worth $12,649,000 as of 
its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also made changes to their positions in the 
business. Morgan Stanley increased its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 52.4% in the 1st quarter. Morgan Stanley 
now owns 498,607 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $26,470,000 after buying an additional 
171,347 shares during the last quarter.  State Street Corp lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 21.9% during the 
1st quarter. State Street Corp now owns 88,058 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $4,675,000 
after purchasing an additional 15,821 shares during the last quarter.  SG Americas Securities LLC boosted its 
position in  Ryanair by 70.2% during the second quarter. SG Americas Securities LLC now owns 13,635 shares of 
the transportation company's stock valued at $905,000 after purchasing an additional 5,622 shares in the last 
quarter.  Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. grew its stake in  Ryanair by 178.6% in the second quarter. Sumitomo 
Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. now owns 52,627 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $3,491,000 
after purchasing an additional 33,738 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Altium Wealth Management LLC 
raised its holdings in  Ryanair by 53.1% in the second quarter. Altium Wealth Management LLC now owns 6,638 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $440,000 after purchasing an additional 2,301 shares in the last 
quarter. Institutional investors own  44.15% of the company's stock.  
A number of research analysts have recently issued reports on RYAAY shares. UBS Group downgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "neutral" rating in a research report on Thursday, November 12th. Barclays  
reaffirmed an "overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Monday, October 19th. JPMorgan 
Chase & Co.  reiterated an "overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Friday. Deutsche Bank 
Aktiengesellschaft  restated a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Thursday, October 1st. 
Finally, Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Monday, September 
14th. Two analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued  a hold rating and eleven have issued  a 
buy rating to the company's stock. Ryanair presently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average target price of 
$84.00. 
UBS Oconnor LLC Grows Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
NASDAQ RYAAY  traded down $0.70 during trading hours on Friday, reaching $104.68. The stock had a trading 
volume of 3,175 shares, compared to its average volume of 690,722. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of 
$44.44 and a 52-week high of $109.65. The stock has a fifty day moving average of $92.10 and a 200 day moving 
average of $78.73. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a current ratio of 0.67. 
The stock has a market cap of $23.72 billion, a P/E ratio of 93.26 and a beta of 1.40.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The 
transportation company reported ($0.12) EPS for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. 
The business had revenue of $1.23 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $1.17 billion. 
Ryanair had a net margin of 3.61% and a return on equity of 10.45%.  On average, equities research analysts 
forecast that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -5.16 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.

positives. Notably, it plans to acquire Maxim Integrated. The deal is expected to drive Analog Devices  growth 
across several emerging growth markets. Additionally, rising adoption of advanced radio systems in 5G 
infrastructures is driving growth of the company s communication business.  The stock has underperformed the 
industry it belongs to on a year-to-date basis. However, weakening momentum across major applications and

Ryanair logo NS Partners Ltd raised its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 13.1% during the 
third quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 127,059 shares 
of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 14,700 shares during the quarter. NS Partners Ltd 
owned about 0.06% of Ryanair worth $10,388,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other hedge funds have also modified their holdings of the company. FMR LLC boosted its holdings in  
Ryanair by 30.9% in the second quarter. FMR LLC now owns 5,276,515 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $350,045,000 after acquiring an additional 1,246,442 shares in the last quarter.  BlackRock Inc. lifted its 
stake in  Ryanair by 605.0% during the 3rd quarter. BlackRock Inc. now owns 419,697 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $34,314,000 after acquiring an additional 360,167 shares during the period.  
Sprucegrove Investment Management Ltd. lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 22.7% during the 2nd quarter. Sprucegrove 
Investment Management Ltd. now owns 1,880,474 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$124,751,000 after acquiring an additional 348,100 shares during the period.  Massachusetts Financial Services 
Co. MA boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 3.7% during the 3rd quarter. Massachusetts Financial 
Services Co. MA now owns 8,822,089 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $721,295,000 after 
acquiring an additional 316,925 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Clark Capital Management Group Inc. 
bought a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the second quarter worth approximately $16,743,000. Hedge funds and 
other institutional investors own  44.15% of the company's stock.  
RYAAY has been the topic of several research reports. AlphaValue upgraded shares of Ryanair to a "sell" rating in 
a report on Tuesday, September 8th. BidaskClub downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
research note on Tuesday, September 29th. Peel Hunt initiated coverage on Ryanair in a research report on 
Tuesday, September 22nd. They set a "sell" rating for the company. JPMorgan Chase & Co.  reissued an 
"overweight" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Monday, October 5th. Finally, Raymond James boosted their 
price target on Ryanair from $90.00 to $100.00 and gave the company an "outperform" rating in a research note on 
Wednesday, October 7th. Two investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued  a hold 
rating and eleven have given a buy rating to the company's stock. The company  has a consensus rating of "Hold" 
and a consensus price target of $84.00. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded down $0.55 during mid-day trading on Thursday, reaching $105.38. 818,533 
shares of the company traded hands, compared to its average volume of 690,722. The company's 50 day moving 
NS Partners Ltd Acquires 14,700 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
average price is $91.70 and its 200-day moving average price is $78.50. The firm has a market cap of $23.72 
billion, a PE ratio of 93.26 and a beta of 1.40. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $44.44 and a 52 week 
high of $109.65. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a current ratio of 0.67 and a quick ratio of 0.67.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The transportation 
company reported ($0.12) earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.26) by $0.14. 
The business had revenue of $1.23 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.17 billion. 
Ryanair had a net margin of 3.61% and a return on equity of 10.45%.  On average, research analysts predict that  
Ryanair Holdings plc will post -5.16 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation and hotel services, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website and mobile app.
